On November 3, a silver Mercedes-Benz driving southbound on 11th encountered a stream of protestors walking along Broadway. Two of the protestors, Margaret So and Lance Laverdure, were struck and transported to the hospital. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering nearby witnesses who called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
On November 3, a silver Mercedes-Benz driving southbound on 11th encountered a stream of protestors walking along Broadway. Two of the protestors, Margaret So and Lance Laverdure, were struck and transported to the hospital. The driver was questioned by BART police and released, angering nearby witnesses who called for the driver's arrest. <ref>{{cite news|last=Kuruvila|first=Matthai|title=Mercedes hits 2 Occupy Oakland protesters|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2011/11/03/BA5G1LQ06S.DTL|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=San Francisco Chronicle|date=November 3, 2011}}</ref>
â
On November 11, the two victims held a press conference alleging that the incident was criminal act and questioning why police had not prosecuted the driver. Victims said that nine days after the incident, they still had not been contacted by police. Lance Laverdure, one of the victims, told press that "We want this person arrested for the attempted murder of myself and Margaret". <ref>KGO [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8429027#&cmp=twi-kgo-article-8429027 Protesters hit by car press for driver's arrest]</ref>
+
On November 11, the two victims held a press conference alleging that the incident was a criminal act and questioned why Oakland Police Department had not prosecuted the driver. Victims said that nine days after the incident, they still had not been contacted by police. Lance Laverdure, one of the victims, told press that "We want this person arrested for the attempted murder of myself and Margaret". <ref>KGO [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8429027#&cmp=twi-kgo-article-8429027 Protesters hit by car press for driver's arrest]</ref>
